main.name: Taylor Bakow
main.description: I'm passionate about using new technologies to innovate and architect business solutions
main.bio: Information Systems Student at Brigham Young University. Interested in software development, cybersecurity, and data analytics/machine learning. Aside from tech, I love golfing, hiking, running, and playing just about any sport. I'm a self proclaimed movie and TV critic. I enjoy playing guitar, especially when accompanying my wife's amazing voice. I have been married since 2016 and my wife and I just had our first baby in August of 2018.
main.contactmessage: Send me a message and lets get in touch!

resume.skillmessage: Here are some of my favorite technologies to work with.

education.school: Brigham Young University - Marriott School of Business

work.title: Salesforce Developer
work.description: Eide Bailly is a top accounting and business advisory firm. I currently work in their technology consulting branch as a Salesforce Developer and Consultant. In my role, I write back-end code using Apex (Java) with SOQL (Salesforce's database query language) and front-end code using JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Salesforce Aura and Lightning Web Components to create features and improve functionality in the Salesforce platform for our clients. Our goal is to help clients effectively integrate Salesforce into their business.

work.title: Enterprise Services Project Manager
work.description: Mozenda is a Provo based software company that has become a market leader in web data scraping. Web scraping is the process by which a person will write scripts programatically to automate pulling text from a website. Through Mozenda's software, web data can be scraped, parsed, cleaned, and shipped to clients in an automated process. Web-scraped data is extremely valuable for business strategy, marketing, analytics, and many other things. During my time at Mozenda I was tasked with both helping Mozenda's largest enterprise clients succeed in their data projects and carrying out the actual projects themselves for other clients.

work.title: Front End Web Developer
work.description: Early in my IS career, I had the chance to intern with PhraseWorthy, a Provo based company that focuses on text analytics. PhraseWorthy uses linguistic algorithms and text analytics to help companies, writers, and journalists come up with phrases, taglines, brand-names, etc. As an intern I was tasked with doing front-end web development to improve website features and functions as well as make the website responsive to mobile devices.

projects.title: Opioid Crisis Database Website
projects.category: Opioid Awareness Project. This was submitted as a final project for a IS multi-class project

projects.title: Zillow Machine Learning
projects.category: Machine Learning Algorithm For Predicting Housing Prices In Utah

projects.title: NBA GOAT Predictor
projects.category: Submitted for a case competition in 2018. Our team used data analytics to create a model for predicting how NBA players compare to one another. 2nd place finish in the Wolf Company annual case competition.

projects.title: Qwix Scoresheet
projects.category: An interactive web interface to save paper on one of our family's favorite games.
